body_content.explanation: If something is determinable, it can be decided or the facts about it can be discovered:
examples: We need determinable performance targets based upon clear business criteria.
At this time, the final outcome of this case is not determinable.

body_content.explanation: able to be terminated (= ended officially) in particular situations:
examples: A yearly tenancy is determinable by the landlord or the tenant at the end of the first year.
The complainant had been given a licence to use a patented invention, determinable on non-payment of the fee.
